fields.description:

[https://www.samanage.com/service-desk/]

fields.description: When tickets are created from our email portal, they have a tendency to come in with multiple attachments due to the signature on the email.  Our support desk specialists has informed me that the only way to delete these is one by one and would find it very useful to be able to remove multiple attachments at the same time; potentially the ability to delete from multiple tickets at the same time while viewing tickets in the queue's.
fields.summary: Allow deletion of multiple attachments at a time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While sending an email to a service desk project's email channel, if the TO/CC list contains email address(es) which are not part of the same organization as the reporter, then none of the CC(ed) email addresses are added as request participants.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a JSD project customer permissions to "*Who can customers share requests with?* Other customers in their organization. If they're not in an organization, they won't find anyone.";
 # Add Customer A and Customer B to an Organization A;
 # Customer A sends an email to the project's email requests address with Customer B and Customer C, on the *To* or *CC** fields.

h3. Expected Results

Jira creates a ticket with Customer A as reporter and Customer B as request participant, Customer C is ignored
h3. Actual Results

Jira creates a ticket only with Customer A as a reporter and ignores Customer B and C as request participant
h3. Workaround

Change customer permissions to "*Who can customers share requests with? Any customer, by typing an email address*."
 _See [How global customer permissions impact project permissions|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/how-global-permissions-affect-project-permissions/#Project-permissions]_.
fields.summary: Adding email address(es) not part of the organization in the TO/CC list will cause even organization customer's emails to not be added as Request Participants.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When an outbound email is bounced, our email service will block that recipient from receiving subsequent emails.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow JSD(Jira Service Desk) admins to search and clear the blocked recipients. Impose a limit of how many times a recipient is able to be unblocked within a given period of time for specific bounces e.g. when the recipient has explicitly blocked JSD emails, or the rejection message relates to the recipient's anti-SPAM/spoof policies.  Having this feature also helps JSD admins when recipients are blocked due to temporary issues that have been resolved such as recipient mailbox full, or the mailbox not existing at the time of the initial delivery attempt.

h3. Why this is important

Allows the customer to have some visibility regarding the deliverability of outbound emails and allows them to take the necessary actions themselves.
h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian Cloud Support to have the recipients unblocked
fields.summary: Clear outbound email blocks/bounces within JSD

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When clicking on the JSD link to edit a knowledge base article written with Confluence's new editor will cause an error on Confluence.
The issue is happening because the link on JSD points to {color:red}https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<SPACE_KEY>/pages/edit/<PAGE_NUMBER>{color} instead of {color:#00875A}https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<SPACE_KEY>/pages/edit-v2/<PAGE_NUMBER>{color}

h3. Environment
 * Jira Service Desk Cloud
 * Confluence Cloud (with the new editor as default)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a space integrated with a JSD project, create a new page;
 # On JSD, access the article and click on *Edit in Confluence*;

h3. Expected Results

The page should be opened in Confluence and it should be possible to edit it.
|!edit_article.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Actual Results

An error is thrown and it's not possible to edit the page:
|!error.png|thumbnail!|

h3. Notes
This is caused by the link to edit the page, which points to /edit/ while the new editor uses /edit-v2/

h3. Workaround
Manually access the page and click to edit it through Confluence.
fields.summary: Link to edit a knowledge base article written on the new editor causes an error on Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

SLA JQL Search functions such as running(),  breached() etc won't bring issues that have been moved.

h3. Environment required

* 2 different SD projects (PA and PZ)
* An SLA ("Time in progress") configured in PZ, which the start trigger exists in both projects. Example: Status *In progress*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue in project PA. (PA-1)
# Transition the issue to *In Progress*.
# Move the issue from PA to PZ. At this point, the SLA should start running in PZ.
# Go to the issue navigator and search for:
{code} Project = PZ and "Time in progress" = running() {code}


h3. Expected Results

The issue PA-1 will be retrieved by the search.

h3. Actual Results
The issue is not retrieved.
 
h3. Notes
If the issue is moved to PZ and then transitioned to *In Progress*, the JQL will retrieve the issue.

h3.Workaround
Updating the SLA settings by editing it and saving it afterwards should fix the search issue.

# Go to the SLA settings and find the affected SLA metric.
# Click on "Edit".
# Click on Save.
fields.summary: SLA JQL functions won't retrieve issues that have been moved from other projects

fields.description:
We are aware of the problem and are working with the Confluence team to repair that functionality as we speak. We will provide with more updates as time goes by.

JSD Cloud team

fields.description:
En ocaciones las epicas son equivalentes a un objetivo, sobre todo cuando lo vemos en formato Gantt. Partiendo desde este punto, los estados del workflow de las épicas no son los mismos que las del resto de las tareas. Quizá una épica simplemente pasa por el proceso para hacer, haciendo, hecho; mientras que el resto de las tareas pueden tener varios pasas mas.

Por otro lado seria muy importante ver el grado de avance en una epica segun las tareas que esta tenga dentro. Es decir de un pantallazo en % de avance esta una Epica.
fields.summary: Epicas en proyectos de ultima generación

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* When using the Service desk report gadget on wallboard, it's hard to tell the reports apart or identify which report is currently displayed on the wallboard.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Give the Service desk report gadget a configurable title field

h3. Why this is important
* When putting the reports on wallboard, it's hard to tell which report is which when there are multiple reports on the wallboard 
 
h3. Workaround 
* No viable workarounds, but some context/info:
** Use the [Introduction gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/adding-the-introduction-gadget-720416983.html](instructions for Server, but works on Cloud) as a report title/label
** [Text gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/text-gadget-module-to-be-removed-858781591.html] has been deprecated
** At the time of writing, the "[Rich text gadget|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214632/rich-text-gadget-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]" is not working on wallboards - might be possible in the future to use the gadget as a report title/label
fields.summary: Service desk report gadget titles

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Some customers are expecting a "submit" button when entering a customer satisfaction rating.  Once a score has been selected, it is automatically registered("submitted").  In the current experience, that's not 100% obvious as the customer might feel unsure as to what to do next:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-29 at 12.38.04.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Suggested Solution
* On a side note: provide customization options - maybe give the option for admins to force customers to make a comment
* Change the wording to something like: "....tell us how it went so we can keep it up.  Your score has been registered - this page can be closed if you do not wish to add a comment."

h3. Why this is important
* Some customers are getting confused as they are expecting to "submit" their score
 
h3. Workaround 
* No action required - once the rating is selected, the score is submitted
fields.summary: Customer Satisfaction(csat): Change wording to make it more obvious that comment isn't necessary

fields.description: We want to move from Zendesk to Jira Service Cloud to be full Jira across development and support but we must be able to create tickets directly from Facebook Messenger messages
fields.summary: Ticket creation from Facebook Messenger messages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When you have configured lots of custom fields under your request type it can get confusing for customers which fields need to be filled in or which fields relate to each other.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be good to somehow insert a (----) line between fields, a spacer option would be good as well

h3. Workaround
No _good_ workarounds known.
The only option I could think of was to use a text field with default test as sort of a 'header'. But that could be more confusing as the customer could actually enter text and it would also appear on the ticket.
fields.summary: Allow for grouping or spacing between fields in the portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The "Find related issues" feature is only added to the custom field types "Domain of Assignee and Domain of Reporter". It could be added to other custom field types, so people could find related issues that have the same field value.
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-24 at 12.18.13.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Suggested Resolution
To have the ability to add this functionality to any custom field type of data.
fields.summary: Ability to add the "Find related issues" to any custom field type of data

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Login-free customer portal it does not create a customer account in case there is a trailing blank space.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable the login-free portal.
# Access the portal and try to raise a request.
# On the *email confirmation to* field start by adding either a leading or trailing space and then complete with your email.
# Submit the request.

h3. Expected Results

Jira should remove the blank space and create the request.

h3. Actual Results

At customer portal the below error message is shown:

{quote}
*Couldn't send request*
Signup is not currently available
{quote}

The below exception is thrown in logs:
{noformat}
stack:	 com.atlassian.jira.exception.CreateException: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.InvalidUserException: User name may not contain leading or trailing whitespace
{noformat}

*Notes:*
It seems a regression of [JSDCLOUD-4134|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4134].
 
h3.Workaround
Remove the trailing spaces and submit the request once again.
fields.summary: Login-free customer portal it does not create a customer account in case there is a leading/trailing blank space on the user email

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The new portal view displays the "Need to raise a request? Contact us" even if there is only 1 request type available.

h3. Suggested Solution
Display the request type instead of "Need to raise a request? Contact us" when there is only 1 request type.

h3. Why this is important
This will allow fewer clicks and less confusion from the Customer side
fields.summary: Display the request type itself when there is only 1 request type

fields.description:
{panel:title=UPDATE}
We have implemented an update to the profile card in Jira Service Desk for the reporter field, which now shows a button for "Reported issues."

When clicked, this will display all issues reported by the given user, as per the screenshot below:

!image-2020-11-06-15-32-05-639.png|width=626,height=218!
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

When I hover my mouse on the name of a customer (reporter field) in an open ticket, a new block appears. Then I click on 'More' button in this block and then 'Current issues' button. I expect to see all issues which the customer has created but I see issues, that is assigned to this customer, that is wrong.
h3. Suggested Solution

Clicking on *Current Issues* for a reporter should show reported issues, not assigned issues
fields.summary: Reporter current issues should show issues reported by user not assigned to user

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When changing the date/time format in Look and Feel Settings the date/time in request form will not change
h3. Environment
 * Jira Service Desk Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to https://<instance.atlassian.net>/secure/admin/LookAndFeel!default.jspa
 # Change *Complete Date/Time Format* to *yyyy/MMM/dd h:mm a*
 # Change *Day/Month/Year Format* to yyyy/MMM/dd
 # Date/time format on Project Queues and within the tickets will reflect the new format
 # Date/time format in Portal request form will not change

h3. Expected Results
 # Date/time format in Portal request form reflect the new format

h3.  Actual Results
 # Date/time format in Portal request form will not change (reflecting as dd/MMM/yyyy)

h3. Workaround

Use "jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format" and date picker "jira.date.picker.javascript.format" to change the format. This can be found under Jira Settings -> General Config -> Advanced settings. See  [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/changing-the-due-date-input-format-192536.html] to see how you can configure that date formats.
fields.summary: Date/time format in request form is not changed by date/time format in Look and Feel settings

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, widget only allows 3 request types to be returned including the default request type set in the widget configuration. So when searching for request types by keywords, if the reuqest types containing the keywords are more than 2, they will not be returned in the results, as the result will be limited to returning only 2 of the request types.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the widget screen to display more than 3 request types to accomadate request type search results.
fields.summary: Widget screen limited to 3 request type, limiting displayed request types

fields.description:
When disabling the email requests, it's not very clear the when customers answer request notifications via email, they will not be processed. In the pop-up displayed it's referred that emails will not be processed but's not clear that this will not affect only the creation of new issues from the email channel.

It would be better if, when disabled, the message clearly states that email responses might be missed because they're not processed.
fields.summary: Improve the email request description

fields.description:
*Summary*

When using the The *new help center* look and feel, in the help center page, if you navigate between help-desks to help center back and forth, intermittently there is a point when you return back to the help center page whereby the help-desk list that usually shows below is loading infinitely and can't be accessed until you refresh  the page. 

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Make sure you are using the new help center feature, enable it via the "Customize" button 
# Go to the Help Center page where all the help-desks are listed
# Click on help-desk followed by clicking on the help-center link followed by another help-desk and so on so forth, repeatedly.

You will reach a point whereby the help center loads the help-desk  list infinitely without showing any content. This happens randomly as well, it may take two cycles or five cycles before the loading becomes infinite, at times even after 15 cycles, the issue does not occur, as such it may be intermittent. 



*Expected Results*

The help center should show the Help-desk list at all times regardless of navigation path. 

*Actual Results*

The help center page at times gets stuck by loading infinitely when navigating between a help-desk to the help-center. 

*Workaround:*

Turn off the "New Help Center" look and feel option via the "Customize" button, the old look and feel, does not have this issue, despite multiple navigation tries the help desk list does not have an infinite loading issue.
fields.summary: Service Desk Help Center List Loads Infinitely, Intermittently.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If there are more than 1 language configured for a portal (one of the project in my example has Ru language) and Announcement message is empty on the default language but filled up on another language (Ru in my example), instead of keeping it empty, Portal show the message from different language

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. How to Reproduce 
h4. Prerequisites
# Configure at least one project with another language
# Add announcement for the Help Center on second language but keep Announcement message empty on the default language
Expected results: Announcement message is empty for the default language
Actual result: There is a message from different language
 !Help_Center_-_Service_Desk_and_Inbox_-_ariadna_romanenko_gmail_com_-_Gmail.jpg|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On some use cases, it would be nice to have the option to add or remove multiple fields to more than one request type per time. For example, a company may want to gather new information from all the requests like the location on which the user is submitting the request. So far that would require to edit each one of the request types in order to add/remove this same field.
fields.summary: Bulk configure request type fields

fields.description:
Customers show in the list of users when I mention them. I would expect an email to be sent to the customer if I mention them in a comment.

This is useful because it simplifies the email notification scheme for us. I can turn off all email notifications and just rely on mentions to email the customer. This helps when I want to roll out the portal to specific customers, and use email correspondence for others.
fields.summary: Mention customers does not sends them an email

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When accessing the Customer list, user will be presented with the customer list along with the number of requests which are open and close. Clicking on these open and closed request will redirect user to the Issue Navigator
h3. Suggested Solution
Redirect customer Open/Closed request from Customer list to a page within JSD application
h3. Why this is important
Avoid the user from needing to navigate back to JSD when they access the list of customer requests.
fields.summary: Redirect customer Open/Closed request from Customer list to a page within JSD application

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The "Contact us about" option is displayed even when there are no request types configured to the project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Service Desk project
# Remove all request types from the project
# Access the customer portal for that project

h3. Expected Results
An empty portal will be displayed
h3. Actual Results
"Contact us about" option is shown and it is not clickable
 
h3. Notes
As some portals are used as a knowledge base repository where no ticket creation is required, the "Contact us about" option is giving a false impression where requests can be created.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Removing all request type from a project still shows the "Contact us about"

fields.description:
Apologies if the functionality already exists, but is there any way to access which articles on a knowledge base are the most popularly-viewed and other analytics like this?

It would be useful to know which page the viewer is coming from when they reach the article as well. Similarly, the page they view after the article would be also be a good thing to know.

Also, a feature on each article such as "Did you find this article helpful?" with a Yes/No response, so we have feedback on which areas of the system to improve, would be great.

Another suggestion would be if we could view the terms that users in the Knowledge Base search for most often, so we can tag the articles more efficiently, is this something that could be done?
fields.summary: More reports for Knowledge Base article views

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the widget is tied to a single project only hence customers would not be able to navigate freely in the widget unlike the navigation in the Customer Portal.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow to navigate to multiple projects within the embeddable widget
h3. Why this is important
This allows customer to efficiently navigate to raise a request or search for KB articles in multiple project from the site the widget is embedded.
fields.summary: Allow to navigate to multiple projects within the embeddable widget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When admins configure a custom email request, there is no warning/reminder to turn off password expiry.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add a warning/reminder to turn off password expiry.
h3. Why this is important
Custom email requests uses an external email account where at times, the email accounts have a password expiration just like any other mail accounts. When the password expires, emails are not received into Service Desk as the connection is not longer authorised causing emails not being converted into requests.
fields.summary: Warn admins to turn off  the "Expire password" option in the option menu of the custom email request

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When navigating from an email notification to an issue, clicking the queue from the sidebar would not automatically open the topmost queue unlike opening the queue on a new tab. Users would need to click on the queue they need to access after clicking the queue menu.
h3. Suggested Solution
Open the topmost queue when navigating to queue from an issue view.
h3. Why this is important
The topmost queue is usually defined as the most important queue. Having it as the landing page (like opening the queue on a new tab) would allow less navigation.
h3. Workaround 
Manually click on the required queue after navigating from an issue view.
fields.summary: Clicking on the queue menu should by default open the topmost queue

fields.description: Currently, automation can only create new tickets. It'd be good if it could also create sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Allow Automation to create sub-tasks

fields.description:
Currently the homepage shows request type categories. We've found the Help Center screen in the portal to be way more effective for helping customers identify which request type they should select. 

 

Please add the same search bar that the customer facing Help Center uses to the homepage. We'd like it front and center. Or the ability to customize where it goes on the homepage ourselves. 

 

Thank you!
fields.summary: Add search bar option to the customer portal home page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confusion is caused becuase Jira users who do not have Jira service desk application access (are not agents) are able to see the "organization" field on Jira issue view of tickets, however, they are not able to search by this field. They expect that since they can see the field value, they should be able to be able to search by the "Organization" field in the Issue Navigator.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Issue Navigator
# Select advance search
# JQL search containing organization field, example: _organization not in ("abc")_


h3. Expected Results
If the Jira users are able to see the "Organization" field on the tickets , they should also be able to search by it. Or, they should not be able to see the organization field on the issue. It is causing confusion. 

h3. Actual Results
# Error retuned stating that only agents are able to use the "Organization" JQL function.
fields.summary: Non-agent users able to see "organization" field on ticket but not able to search by it

fields.description:
Implement the ability to set a field to editable in the Help Center.  Currently when a request is submitted there is not point of return for the creator to edit.  This can be done in the Project, but not Request in the Help Center. 

Best case scenario is the ability to make field editable when configuring fields in the Request Type.
fields.summary: Editable Fields from the Help Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the customer is on two or more organizations and you remove him from all others, leaving just one, his requests are not automatically shared with the organization when creating tickets using the email channel.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a customer in two or more organizations
# Remove the customer from all the other organizations and leave on just one

h3. Expected Results

When sending requests via email, the requests should default to that remaining organization

h3. Actual Results

Requests do not default to the organization
 
h3. Workaround

Removing and adding the customers back to the desired organization will make requests default again to that organization when creating requests via email.
fields.summary: Leaving customer only on one organization don't share request when creating from email

fields.description: Sometimes a customer will leave a 1 star rating with no comments. It'd be good to have the comment field required so we can always improve our services.
fields.summary: As a Jira Service Desk admin, I'd like to set comments on CSAT surveys as required

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With the launch of the new user profiles in our products located under the /people part of instances portal only customers(customers without an Atlassian Account) no longer have their profile available.

* Internal users (Atlassian Accounts) without any application access (customers) also don't have a profile available.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the +Customers+ section of a service desk project.
# Hover your mouse over a portal only customer, on the popup, click on the customer name.

h3. Expected Results

The profile of the customer should be loaded.

h3. Actual Results

You're redirected to:
{noformat:none|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
https://{instance}.atlassian.net/people/search
{noformat}

No profile is loaded nor you can find that customer profile here.

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Clicking on the customer's profile card doesn't show their information

fields.description:
The way the localization handling catches most of the language strings is a bit of a false friend, as the pre-set automation rules that are available out of the box also contain language content which only really becomes visible when a customer complains about it.

It would be helpful if the *Add comment* function of the automation rule would somehow be picked up by the localization handling so that it is included. It's easy enough to use the "Request language = de/en/etc." to branch off the actual automations themselves, so it's just about increasing the visibility really.

Apologies if this is has already been flagged in a different ticket.
fields.summary: Expand Localization function to cover Automation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the current/"old" help center in either Dutch or German, the date/time picker on the request form doesn't allow the customer to conveniently pick a time.
h3. Environment
 * JSD Cloud
 * "Old"/current help center

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Place a date/time picker in a request/portal form
 # Navigate to the portal
 # Try to set a date/time value

h3. Expected Results
 * The customer is able to select a time and set a date/time value

h3. Actual Results
 * Challenging for customers to pick a time
 * The mouse pointer is over the "Hour" picker:
 !Jan-03-2019 11-34-15.gif!

h3. Notes
 * The tool-tip is longer than the width of the date picker, so the picker "flickers"
 * Seems to affect the portal when the language is set to Dutch or German

h3. Workaround
 * Slowly move the mouse pointer to the right of the picker as shown in this video: [^date_time_picker.mov]
 * Use the [new help center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2018/12/our-new-help-center-is-ready-for-your-customers-to-experience](instructions in the linked blog post). Please keep in mind that due to JSDCLOUD-6874, the calendar months/days will be in English
fields.summary: Portal: Unable to select time using the date/time picker when using the portal in Dutch/German

fields.description:
Hi,

We recently replaced our service desk application with Jira Service Desk which is going perfect so far.

However, we lost some of functions which is very useful like adding signature of the agent who handles the request.

Also we saw that we can't add images as attachment to replies. This is not good for an agent when agent shares any visual element with customer.

Can you share your opinion about possibility to add these feature?

Thanks,

Ertürk Varol
fields.summary: Adding signature option for agent, adding image in replies...

fields.description:
We have 200+ projects mapped to our different clients, one project per client.

Each of these projects have the same automation rule set that is currently manually applied to them one by one.

An option to create the rule once and them copy it to another project will be very helpful.
fields.summary: Add an option to copy automation rules between projects

fields.description:
Currently, when adding images on a page or add the macro Gallery, for example, and the space is linked to an SD project in order to share it with customers, they won't be able to click on the image in order to expand.
 It would be great if we have the ability to click on the image to preview it to check more details of the image.
fields.summary: Ability to open images from a Knowledge base on Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* There isn't a timestamp to track customer activities for portal-only customer accounts or Atlassian accounts used by Jira Software/core users
* When a customer sends in an email to make a comment or a new request - the current "last active" timestamp isn't updated

h3. Suggested Solution
* Log/display information relating to a user's(customer's) last activity - new request creation, comment, etc.

h3. Why this is important
* Admins need to know the date of a customer's last activity in order to maintain their userbase
* Allows admins to deactivate accounts based on last activity, i.e. has this customer created a request via email in the last 3 months?
 
h3. Workaround 
* None
fields.summary: Allow admins to get/export the "Last Activity" date of users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Changing customer notification (Public comment added) to send bold text only works if the comment is added without any line break.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On customer notification, click on "Edit" for "Public comment added".
# Select ${comment} and click on "B" to set the text as bold.
# Go to a ticket where the reporter is a customer and the request type is correctly set.
# Add a comment with multiple lines. 

h3. Expected Results

Customer receives the notification and all text is bold or italic or underlined.

h3. Actual Results

It only shows the "*", "_" or "+" on the beginning and the end of the text.
fields.summary: Notification does not respect the format set on "Customer notification"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to edit a time/date picker field on the portal via a mobile web browser, the keyboard on iOS cannot be minimized so that the entire calendar/time picker is visible.  The page scroll is locked - so it's not possible to scroll up/down to reveal the hidden portion(s) of the calendar/time picker.  Android users are able to minimize the keyboard and choose the desired date/time.

h3. Environment
* Jira
* iOS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the portal
# Try to edit a date/time picker field

h3. Expected Results
* A calendar/time picker appears in full and the user is able to choose a time/date by tapping on a time/date option

h3. Actual Results
* The keyboard covers the calendar/time picker
* User is unable to minimize the keyboard so that the entire calendar/time picker is visible
 !Image 2018-12-19 at 16.32.01.jpeg|thumbnail! !Image 2018-12-19 at 16.32.01-2.jpeg|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Issue occurs when using the "new help center"
* Able to replicate issue on multiple iOS devices
* Confirmed that the issue occurs on iOS 11.4.1
* Issue occurs in Chrome and Safari
* Time picker is not scrollable on either Android or iOS
* Unable to scroll up/down to reveal the hidden portion of the calendar/time picker

h3.Workaround
 * Turn off the new help center: Navigate to Project Settings > Portal Settings > View and customize; under Try the new help center, put the toggle switch into the "off" position.  Please quote this bug ticket number in the feedback form.
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-11 at 11.37.11 PM (1) (1).png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: New help center/iOS:  The date/time picker is hidden by the keyboard in the portal
Link Service Desk Project to more than one Confluence Space

fields.description:
When a customer searches in the widget search bar, he has to type the entire word to get results from the knowledge base.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 * Create an article "How to make a slider"
 * Type on the widget search bar "slid"

*Expected results:*
 * The list should return the article "How to make a slider"

*Current results:*
 * No results are shown
fields.summary: Widget search doesn't match incomplete words

h3. Workaround
# Change the project key of the project to something other than WEBMASTER
# Enable the email requests
# Change the project key back.
fields.summary: Enabling email requests on a project with the key WEBMASTER returns an error which suggest a mailstore connection issue

fields.description:
Will you please add the ability to sort Requests (Individual User Requests Page) by column header? 

This would be incredibly useful. 

!image-2018-12-27-07-48-23-514.png!
fields.summary: Add Ability to Sort Requests by Column

fields.description:
Will you please consider the allowing the ability for Project Admins to modify the State Date and Time of a ticket after it has already been started?  The SLA would also need to reset based on the new State Date and Time. 

It looks like I could change the Start Date and Time with an import (assumption) overwrite, but that is not a feasible solution long-term. 

I created this community inquiry ticket as well: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Desk-questions/Can-the-Create-Date-and-Time-be-manually-edited-on-a-ticket-for/qaq-p/967832?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=mentions_answer&utm_content=topic#U969391]
fields.summary: Allow the Ability for Project Admins to Modify the Start Date/Time of an Issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when a ticket have multiple approvers and only needed one approver, once the ticket is approved, under approvals still listed all the approver.

h3. Suggested Solution
Once issue approved, under approvals, only display user who approved the ticket.

h3. Why this is important
 Customer will only have visibility who approved the ticket.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Approvals will only display user who approved the ticket if it have multiple of approvers

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

The "Issue Layout" menu is not available yet for Jira Service Desk projects, so it's not possible to edit the order of the tickets in the new issue detail view when adding Service Desk tickets to a board.

It causes the *Configure* option at the three dots button(...) of the detail view to don't work, leading to a blank page instead of the *Issue Layout* page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Enable the new issue detail view
 * Create a new board (Scrum or Kanban)
 * Add a Service Desk Ticket to board
 * Click on the ticket to open the Detail View 
 * Click on the three dots icon > Configure

!Screen Shot 2018-12-26 at 18.39.02.png|width=430,height=174!
h3. Expected Results

The option should lead to the Issue Layout menu of the project.
h3. Actual Results

It leads to a blank page:

!Screen Shot 2018-12-26 at 18.39.13.png|width=423,height=303!
fields.summary: Configure option on the new Issue Detail View leading to a blank page for Service Desk tickets

fields.description:
*This capability was shipped on 4 Nov 2019. The ability to reorder the context section of Jira Service Desk requests can be accessed via the "Issue view" tab, whilst editing a request type.*


----


The "Issue Layout" is not available yet for Jira Service Desk projects, so it's not possible to edit the order of the tickets in the new issue detail view when adding Service Desk tickets to a board.
fields.summary: Enable Issue Layout for JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Default values are not shown on the help center for the multiline CF type.
h3. Environment

Help Center.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a custom field and set a default value;
 # Add the custom field to the request type;
 # Check in the help center if the default value is shown.

h3. Expected results

The default value should be present at the help center.
h3. Actual result

The default value is not shown.
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Jira configured default value isn't populated consistently in some of the portal fields depending on the type

fields.description: I would like to be able to embed Jira Service desk in my software and have customer information pre-filled based on their credentials in my software if they go to submit a support request.
fields.summary: Allow pre-filled values in service desk via GET variables

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
# Go to a Service Desk project queue;
# Enter a ticket;
# Try to drag and drop attachments;

*Expected Results*
A popup should appear while the attachment is added

*Actual Results*
When "dropping" the attachment, it will not be added to the ticket

*Workaround*
Refresh the page

*Video demonstrating the problem*
 [^attachments.mp4]
fields.summary: Unable to drag and drop attachments when viewing a ticket coming from the redesigned queue

fields.description:
Currently in Jira Service Desk, if a customer with approval rights leaves on vacation, there's no way for them to delegate their rights to someone else.

It would be great to have the ability to set a temporary approver in such scenarios.

fields.description:
Hi Jira, 

We are in the process of customising our outbound email address but we have encountered a blocker.

We would like our emails to be fully University of York branded so users are not receiving  Jira@universityofyork.atlassian.net

It is possible to set up a DKIM without an SPF record? We have been to [https://domain-check.atlassian.io/] which has indicated that we are missing DKIM for S1 and S2 and SPF entry.

Is there a way to set the from address to be a York address, but the envelope address to be a sub-domain of york.ac.uk, for example @notifications.york.ac.uk.

Is it possible to proceed without SPF if we have set up DKIM? Our email administrator has advised us that we do not have a policy of using SPF therefore this could be a substantial blocker for us in rolling out usage of ServiceDesk across our organisation. 

Kind regards, 

Erin McWilliams
fields.summary: Customised outbound email issue.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there’s a limit of 20 categories per service desk and 50 articles per category. This is not sufficient for some Help Desks which try to promote self-help platform.

h3. Suggested Solution
Increase the maximum number of articles per category.

h3. Why this is important
* Knowledge is the first contact points for the customers
* Categorize the knowledge correctly would make the customers easier to look for the correct knowledge
* Company that promote self-help basis would have a higher number of the articles and the mentioned maximum number is not sufficient
fields.summary: Increase the limit of the KB categories

fields.description:

Currently, Google Group is not an actual email account and cannot be configured to be used for an email request.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to configure email request using Google Groups
h3. Why this is important
Support implementations before using Jira Service Desk are already using Google Groups as the email to retrieve support cases. This limitation would require a new email account as Google Groups is not currently supported.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Wider logos on smaller screens, in JIRA Service Desk portal, are not automatically resized when the portal is accessed from smaller screens and because of this, the profile icon is not displayed unless the user reduces the page zoom.

# view the portal from a smaller device

The logo is resized in order to all elements be displayed on the screen

The logo is not resized and the profile icon is not displayed on the screen

The View open/closed requests in the organization list displays all requests created by the organization members instead of tickets shared with that organization.

Gives admins/agents a quick overview of the actual number requests created within a specific organization

Use JQL to find shared with organization to find the correct number of tickets shared with organization members.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

By default, the announcement message in the new help center appears collapsed. If there are multiple lines of text within the announcement message, then the whole text isn't displayed until the message is manually expanded. Long announcement titles are also "cut-off" - the entire title is not displayed until the announcement text is manually expanded.

 !Dec-12-2018 09-27-42.gif! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow admins to force the help center announcement message to appear expanded by default.
h3. Why this is important

Some admins are putting important information for customers e.g. support hours, disclaimers, etc. This information can be missed if the announcement message is collapsed
h3. Workaround
 * Manually expand the message + title
 * Start the announcement with something like "Expand for more information"
 * Move the information to the [Customer notification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-service-desk-notifications-732528936.html#Configuringservicedesknotifications-Edit,disable,andcustomizenotifications] > Request created template, so that customers receive the announcement information when they create a new request
fields.summary: New help center: Announcement message collapsing by default + announcement title not fully displayed

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the user that runs the Service Desk automation rules doesn't have *Browse Users and Groups* global permission, users mentioned by the automation will not receive the email notification.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user with Jira Service Desk Agent permission.
 # Make sure that the user *doesn't have* browse users permission.
 # Set the user as the default one for Automation Execution.
 # Create an "Alert User" automation rule, setting a few users to be mentioned.
 # Create an issue that triggers the rule above.

h3. Expected Results

Any automation rule with a notification action *and* a run-as-user who is missing Browse Users and Groups permission will fail validation and show a warning icon in the rules summary or rule editing settings pages. Similar to the warning that displays when a user is deleted while being a run-as-user for an automation rule.
h3. Actual Results

The comment with all the user mentions is correctly created, however, users will not receive an email notification about the mention. There is no misconfiguration warning in the automation settings.  
h3. Workaround

Provide the user that runs the automation with *Browse Users and Groups* global permission.
fields.summary: Alert users automation rule will not trigger notifications if the automation user does not have global permission.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "Customer invited" customer notification toggle switch reverts back to original state when using Jira Service Desk in specific languages.
||Affected languages||Unaffected languages||
|Korean (South Korea)
 Russian (Russia)
 Hungarian (Hungary)
 Portuguese (Brazil)
 German (Germany)
 Czech (Czech Republic)
 Icelandic (Iceland)
 Danish (Denmark)
 Estonian (Estonia)
 Slovak (Slovakia)
 Portuguese (Portugal)
 Vietnamese (Vietnam)
 Spanish (Spain)
 Swedish (Sweden)
 Chinese (China)
 Japanese (Japan)
 Finnish (Finland)
 French (France)
 Polish (Poland)
 română (România)
 Norwegian (Norway)|Italian (Italy)
 English US/UK
 Dutch (Netherlands)|
h3. Environment
 * Jira Service Desk Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Project settings > Customer notifications
 # Click the toggle switch to enable/disable the "Customer invited" notification
 # Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results
* The toggle switch stays in the desired state/position

h3. Actual Results
 * The setting changes back to the original state. For example, when trying to disable to "Customer invited" notification, the switch is put in the "off" position
* After refreshing the page, the setting is "on" without any input from the user
 See: [^Dec-07-2018 16-28-53.mp4]

h3. Notes
 * Only the "Customer invited" notification seems to be affected
 * Project language on test instance is Polish, also tried setting the project language to English(US) and setting the personal language setting to Polish - was able to reproduce the issue
* This is the call that is made when Jira is using one of the affected languages(see table above):
{code}
Request URL: https://dnguyen4-test2.atlassian.net/rest/servicedesk/notifications/1/rule/AJ/ruleset/invite-customer
Request Method: POST
Status Code: 404 
{code}

h3. Workaround
 * Edit the notification rule, uncheck "Enable" and save the changes
fields.summary: "Customer invited" customer notification toggle switch setting reverts back to original state when using Jira Service Desk in specific languages

Currently, when a customer account migrate to Atlassian Account, any comment added by customer previously (before migrate the customer account to Atlassian Account) will still remain pointing to the old customer account. Only reporter will change pointing to new Atlassian Account.

 !Screen Shot 2018-12-06 at 3.48.02 PM.png|thumbnail!

Cloud

The comment author should change to the new atlassian account.

h3. Actual Results
The comment author still remains the old account.

For example, screenshot below :-
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-06 at 3.48.02 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Comment author doesn't change to new Atlassian Account after customer account migrate to Atlassian Account

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Normally when a customer create issue via email, the email is forwarded to external email that is not added as "Request Participant" or Organization to the ticket. Due to that, when the external user replied the email , the email is not added as comment to the existing ticket. In Cloud environment there's no way to allow it , except the issue need to shared to the user first. 

In JSD server , the feature "Public Email Comments" already released and it allow emails from addresses which are currently not registered as customers of your service desk or the issue not shared to the customer, to be added as comments to the associated request. This is explain in [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/receiving-requests-by-email-939926303.html#Receivingrequestsbyemail-Preparecustomersforemailgreatness] documentation.

This is how it look in Server environment:-
 !emailimage.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be great for this feature to be released to Cloud environment too.

h3. Why this is important
This will allow the non shared customer to add a comment via email and it will reduce duplicate ticket created from email. 

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Release "Public Email Comments" feature in JSD Cloud Environment

fields.description:
We are in the early stages of using JSD to capture support requests from our customers.  Our customers will be reporting issues from within our website where they are already logged in (and have an email address associated with their account).

The existing JSD widget looks perfect, except that it requires the customer to manually enter an email address.  This means that some customers will inevitably create tickets with email addresses which don't match the email address we have on record (which then makes supporting their requests harder).

It would be great if there a way to prefill the email address field in the widget (ideally so the customer can't change it)?

Thanks, Adam.

Original question [here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Desk-questions/Automatically-setting-customer-email-address-for-Jira-Service/qaq-p/952901].
fields.summary: Prefill email field in Service Desk widget

fields.description:
As the Release Coordinator for my company, it would be extremely convenient if JIRA allowed you to export the release notes from each release in an Excel spread sheet. It would save me the headache of copying every issue separately to format each cell.  I really need something that is organized and easily shared with my team, but also professional enough to send to clients!  

Even just a basic spreadsheet with columns for Ticket Number and Summary would be helpful, and adding in customizable fields would be fantastic!
fields.summary: New Feature: Export Release Notes from JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As default in Jira, only the parent key is shown when displaying the sub-task summary. This is also true when displaying the sub-tasks in queues

|Issue Key|Summary|
|Subtask IssueKey|Parent IssueKey / Sub-task Summary|

Sub-tasks lacks the parent summary information from the queue. The agent needs to open the parent issue to get the actual details.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow to expose the parent issue summary of a sub-task in queues (ie. additional column called *Parent Summary*).
fields.summary: Show the parent summary of sub-tasks in the JSD queues.

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

It would be nice to have the ability to configure the edit screens based upon on the request type instead of the issue type.

Here it follows some use cases on which this it would be a nice to have:

For requests raised via email, we can only have a default request type. Analyzing the ticket we need to do a triage on those request and then change the request type as desired and on this new request type, we may have additional custom fields that need to be provided by the agents. As so far the screens are based upon on the Issue type, all the fields for that specific issue type will be shown and it keeps hard to agents know which fields they need to edit for that specific request.

Another scenario on which it would be useful is for when the customer submits the request and we need to edit and add some additional information about that specific request as well.
h3. Suggestion:

If we were able to set up edit screens based upon on Request types it would be much easier to Agents edit the tickets.
fields.summary: Add the ability to configure Jira Screens based upon on Request Types
